intro: Dipteracanthus orthocaulus, commonly known as the slender spike rush, is a flowering plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and a tall, unbranched stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typical of the sedge family. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and wetlands. Dipteracanthus orthocaulus plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various small organisms.
